metadata.Title: CVE-2017-10784 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The Basic authentication code in WEBrick library in Ruby before 2.2.8, 2.3.x before 2.3.5, and 2.4.x through 2.4.1 allows remote attackers to inject terminal emulator escape sequences into its log and possibly execute arbitrary commands via a crafted user name.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-10784` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libruby2.3 - 2.3.1-2~16.04.5
ruby2.3 - 2.3.1-2~16.04.5
ruby2.3-tcltk - 2.3.1-2~16.04.5
No subscription required

criterions.comment: ruby2.3 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.3.1-2~16.04.5').
